Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory121.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: "Let's begin our deal then.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Despite the situation of the train not looking good, and the floorboards ferociously shaking under his feet, the man named Aston didn't waver an inch."}
{3: 'Maintaining his pace, he strides forward with confidence, and even saluted Gray Raven.'}
{2: 'What deal?', 3: '9', 4: "Aren't there more pressing matters right now?", 5: '14'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Those two Constructs just no mentioned a deal as well... Care to explain what that is?', 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: 'Babylonia sent you here without explaining the situation to you beforehand?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: "To a merchant, there's nothing more important than trading.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'It seems that you have not fully grasped the situation yet...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'Allow me to explain.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Aston', 3: 'According to our intel, there was a huge battle between Babylonia and the space station not so long ago. And in that battle, "something important" that belonged to the space station crashed onto this train.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'That is correct. Please destroy it together with us...', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: 'No, we will not, and will not allow you to do so. Unless we reach a deal.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'After all, that is our most valuable merchandise.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "You're using the Hetero-Core as a bargaining chip...? Are you people mad? That's the enemy of all humanity!", 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: 'Anyhow, our demand is simple—let us move in to Babylonia.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: 'Hmph, asking useless questions.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'Babylonia in outer space is currently the safest place in the universe. Although this train has kept us alive,', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'I still believe going to Babylonia is the only way to achieve true safety.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'What do you think about this deal, commandant from Babylonia?', 4: '1'}
{2: "I'm not authorized to make this deal.", 3: '44', 4: 'And if we refuse...?', 5: '47'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: "Then who has the authority to do so, and can you get in contact with them? I'd like a reply as soon as possible, if not...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: "Ahaha, I knew they wouldn't agree to the terms. Which is good, because now...", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: "Then I guess we'll have to make the deal with the Ascendants then.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jamilah', 3: "Wait, that's not what we agreed on before. We agreed to wait for an answer from Babylonia first...", 4: '3'}
{3: 'Their leader, a teenage girl who stood silently when the aristocrat was talking, suddenly objected.'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: "Little girls shouldn't meddle in this matter. And it's obvious, the Ascendants are far more superior to those from Babylonia.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: 'Ashlar, Princess Jamilah is the current leader of the ACA, and as a member of Akdilek, you should show some respect.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ashlar', 3: '...Of course.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "I don't know what your situation is, but... You guys are on the Ascendants' side?!", 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: "There's no friend or foe in commerce. While you were dilly-dallying, this train has been approaching the designated meeting point with the Ascendants.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'We are merchants, and we only want to gain the biggest profit from a deal. To us, both Babylonia and the Ascendants are just trading partners.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'And as you can see, Ashlar suggested the Ascendants as our trading partner, while I, on the other hand, wanted to expand our options.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Us?', 3: '71', 4: 'Why would you make deal with the Ascendants?', 5: '75'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'Yes, if Babylonia can provide a satisfying answer swiftly, then we need not head toward such dangerous areas full of Punishing Virus to "deliver the goods."', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: "From how I see it, it's a win-win, and all that are wise would choose this.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ashlar', 3: "Of course it's to become one of them! To be able to travel freely in this day and age is more valuable than anything else.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Changyu', 3: 'Tsk, no one is guaranteed to be able to become an Ascendant!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ashlar', 3: 'No one asked for your opinion, peasant.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'This alarm?', 3: '86', 4: 'Is the train under attack?', 5: '86'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Something probably happened to the Hetero-Core...', 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: 'Looks like the commoner carriages in the back have been assaulted by the Corrupted.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: "What?! Then it's dangerous to stay here, we need to head for the front carriages now!", 4: '2'}
{3: 'The aristocrats behind Ashlar become agitated—'}
{3: 'Some even ignore the leader of Akdilek standing right in front of them and scramble for the front carriages.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: "I guess there's nothing else we can do here. We should retreat for now.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'Leader, please follow me', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: '...No matter how I look at it, that man named Aston feels more like the leader of Akdilek to me.', 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "Now's not the time for observations. Commandant, we...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Go save people.', 3: '111', 4: 'Destroy the Corrupted', 5: '115'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Lee and I will hold back the Corrupted ahead. Liv, provide medical assistance in the back.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'Sophia, can I count on you?', 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Sophia', 3: 'Your wish is my command.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Changyu', 3: 'Wait, what about me?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: '...Leader, I remember warning you not to deploy Constructs casually, at least not in front of others.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: 'And Changyu, you may not go. The aristocrats will riot if we deploy all our Constructs right now.', 4: '1'}
